39#include "includes.h"
40__RCSID("$NetBSD: match.c,v 1.11 2019/04/20 17:16:40 christos Exp $");
41#include <sys/types.h>
42
43#include <ctype.h>
44#include <stdlib.h>
45#include <string.h>
46#include <stdio.h>

48#include "xmalloc.h"
49#include "match.h"
50#include "misc.h"
51
52/*
53 * Returns true if the given string matches the pattern (which may contain ?
54 * and * as wildcards), and zero if it does not match.
55 */
56
57int
58match_pattern(const char *s, const char *pattern)
59{
60 for (;;) {
61 /* If at end of pattern, accept if also at end of string. */
62 if (!*pattern)
63 return !*s;
64
65 if (*pattern == '*') {
66 /* Skip the asterisk. */
67 pattern++;
68
69 /* If at end of pattern, accept immediately. */
70 if (!*pattern)
71 return 1;
72
73 /* If next character in pattern is known, optimize. */
74 if (*pattern != '?' && *pattern != '*') {
75 /*
76 * Look instances of the next character in
77 * pattern, and try to match starting from
78 * those.
79 */
80 for (; *s; s++)
81 if (*s == *pattern &&
82 match_pattern(s + 1, pattern + 1))
83 return 1;
84 /* Failed. */
85 return 0;
86 }
87 /*
88 * Move ahead one character at a time and try to
89 * match at each position.
90 */
91 for (; *s; s++)
92 if (match_pattern(s, pattern))
93 return 1;
94 /* Failed. */
95 return 0;
96 }
97 /*
98 * There must be at least one more character in the string.
99 * If we are at the end, fail.
100 */
101 if (!*s)
102 return 0;
103
104 /* Check if the next character of the string is acceptable. */
105 if (*pattern != '?' && *pattern != *s)
106 return 0;
107
108 /* Move to the next character, both in string and in pattern. */
109 s++;
110 pattern++;
111 }
112 /* NOTREACHED */
113}
114
115/*
116 * Tries to match the string against the
117 * comma-separated sequence of subpatterns (each possibly preceded by ! to
118 * indicate negation). Returns -1 if negation matches, 1 if there is
119 * a positive match, 0 if there is no match at all.
120 */
121int
122match_pattern_list(const char *string, const char *pattern, int dolower)
123{
124 char sub[1024];
125 int negated;
126 int got_positive;
127 u_int i, subi, len = strlen(pattern);
128
129 got_positive = 0;
130 for (i = 0; i < len;) {
131 /* Check if the subpattern is negated. */
132 if (pattern[i] == '!') {
133 negated = 1;
134 i++;
135 } else
136 negated = 0;
137
138 /*
139 * Extract the subpattern up to a comma or end. Convert the
140 * subpattern to lowercase.
141 */
142 for (subi = 0;
143 i < len && subi < sizeof(sub) - 1 && pattern[i] != ',';
144 subi++, i++)
145 sub[subi] = dolower && isupper((u_char)pattern[i]) ?
146 tolower((u_char)pattern[i]) : pattern[i];
147 /* If subpattern too long, return failure (no match). */
148 if (subi >= sizeof(sub) - 1)
149 return 0;
150
151 /* If the subpattern was terminated by a comma, then skip it. */
152 if (i < len && pattern[i] == ',')
153 i++;
154
155 /* Null-terminate the subpattern. */
156 sub[subi] = '\0';
157
158 /* Try to match the subpattern against the string. */
159 if (match_pattern(string, sub)) {
160 if (negated)
161 return -1; /* Negative */
162 else
163 got_positive = 1; /* Positive */
164 }
165 }
166
167 /*
168 * Return success if got a positive match. If there was a negative
169 * match, we have already returned -1 and never get here.
170 */
171 return got_positive;
172}
173
174/* Match a list representing users or groups. */
175int
176match_usergroup_pattern_list(const char *string, const char *pattern)
177{
178 /* Case sensitive match */
179 return match_pattern_list(string, pattern, 0);
180}
181
182/*
183 * Tries to match the host name (which must be in all lowercase) against the
184 * comma-separated sequence of subpatterns (each possibly preceded by ! to
185 * indicate negation). Returns -1 if negation matches, 1 if there is
186 * a positive match, 0 if there is no match at all.
187 */
188int
189match_hostname(const char *host, const char *pattern)
190{
191 char *hostcopy = xstrdup(host);
192 int r;
193
194 lowercase(hostcopy);
195 r = match_pattern_list(hostcopy, pattern, 1);
196 free(hostcopy);
197 return r;
198}
199
200/*
201 * returns 0 if we get a negative match for the hostname or the ip
202 * or if we get no match at all. returns -1 on error, or 1 on
203 * successful match.
204 */
205int
206match_host_and_ip(const char *host, const char *ipaddr,
207 const char *patterns)
208{
209 int mhost, mip;
210
211 if ((mip = addr_match_list(ipaddr, patterns)) == -2)
212 return -1; /* error in ipaddr match */
213 else if (host == NULL || ipaddr == NULL || mip == -1)
214 return 0; /* negative ip address match, or testing pattern */
215
216 /* negative hostname match */
217 if ((mhost = match_hostname(host, patterns)) == -1)
218 return 0;
219 /* no match at all */
220 if (mhost == 0 && mip == 0)
221 return 0;
222 return 1;
223}
224
225/*
226 * Match user, user@host_or_ip, user@host_or_ip_list against pattern.
227 * If user, host and ipaddr are all NULL then validate pattern/
228 * Returns -1 on invalid pattern, 0 on no match, 1 on match.
229 */
230int
231match_user(const char *user, const char *host, const char *ipaddr,
232 const char *pattern)
233{
234 char *p, *pat;
235 int ret;
236
237 /* test mode */
238 if (user == NULL && host == NULL && ipaddr == NULL) {
239 if ((p = strchr(pattern, '@')) != NULL &&
240 match_host_and_ip(NULL, NULL, p + 1) < 0)
241 return -1;
242 return 0;
243 }
244
245 if ((p = strchr(pattern,'@')) == NULL)
246 return match_pattern(user, pattern);
247
248 pat = xstrdup(pattern);
249 p = strchr(pat, '@');
250 *p++ = '\0';
251
252 if ((ret = match_pattern(user, pat)) == 1)
253 ret = match_host_and_ip(host, ipaddr, p);
254 free(pat);
255
256 return ret;
257}
258
259/*
260 * Returns first item from client-list that is also supported by server-list,
261 * caller must free the returned string.
262 */
263#define MAX_PROP 40
264#define SEP ","
265char *
266match_list(const char *client, const char *server, u_int *next)
267{
268 char *sproposals[MAX_PROP];
269 char *c, *s, *p, *ret, *cp, *sp;
270 int i, j, nproposals;
271
272 c = cp = xstrdup(client);
273 s = sp = xstrdup(server);
274
275 for ((p = strsep(&sp, SEP)), i=0; p && *p != '\0';
276 (p = strsep(&sp, SEP)), i++) {
277 if (i < MAX_PROP)
278 sproposals[i] = p;
279 else
280 break;
281 }
282 nproposals = i;
283
284 for ((p = strsep(&cp, SEP)), i=0; p && *p != '\0';
285 (p = strsep(&cp, SEP)), i++) {
286 for (j = 0; j < nproposals; j++) {
287 if (strcmp(p, sproposals[j]) == 0) {
288 ret = xstrdup(p);
289 if (next != NULL)
290 *next = (cp == NULL) ?
291 strlen(c) : (u_int)(cp - c);
292 free(c);
293 free(s);
294 return ret;
295 }
296 }
297 }
298 if (next != NULL)
299 *next = strlen(c);
300 free(c);
301 free(s);
302 return NULL;
303}
304
305/*
306 * Filter proposal using pattern-list filter.
307 * "blacklist" determines sense of filter:
308 * non-zero indicates that items matching filter should be excluded.
309 * zero indicates that only items matching filter should be included.
310 * returns NULL on allocation error, otherwise caller must free result.
311 */
312static char *
313filter_list(const char *proposal, const char *filter, int blacklist)
314{
315 size_t len = strlen(proposal) + 1;
316 char *fix_prop = malloc(len);
317 char *orig_prop = strdup(proposal);
318 char *cp, *tmp;
319 int r;
320
321 if (fix_prop == NULL || orig_prop == NULL) {
322 free(orig_prop);
323 free(fix_prop);
324 return NULL;
325 }
326
327 tmp = orig_prop;
328 *fix_prop = '\0';
329 while ((cp = strsep(&tmp, ",")) != NULL) {
330 r = match_pattern_list(cp, filter, 0);
331 if ((blacklist && r != 1) || (!blacklist && r == 1)) {
332 if (*fix_prop != '\0')
333 strlcat(fix_prop, ",", len);
334 strlcat(fix_prop, cp, len);
335 }
336 }
337 free(orig_prop);
338 return fix_prop;
339}
340
341/*
342 * Filters a comma-separated list of strings, excluding any entry matching
343 * the 'filter' pattern list. Caller must free returned string.
344 */
345char *
346match_filter_blacklist(const char *proposal, const char *filter)
347{
348 return filter_list(proposal, filter, 1);
349}
350
351/*
352 * Filters a comma-separated list of strings, including only entries matching
353 * the 'filter' pattern list. Caller must free returned string.
354 */
355char *
356match_filter_whitelist(const char *proposal, const char *filter)
357{
358 return filter_list(proposal, filter, 0);
359}
